marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Records Indonesian Consumer Confidence Index Decreased to 127.2 in January 2025
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia noted that the Indonesian consumer confidence index decreased to 127.2 in January 2025 (vs. December 2024: 127.7), marking the first decline in the last 3 months. All sub-indexes within the current economic conditions index experienced a decrease, while the consumer expectations index still rose in line with the increase in the income expectations and business activity expectations sub-indexes.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Projects January 2025 Retail Sales to Grow +0.4% YoY
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia estimates that retail sales in January 2025 will grow +0.4% YoY, although contracting -4.8% MoM in line with the normalization of public demand post-Christmas and New Year celebrations. Meanwhile, retail sales in December 2024 grew +1.8% YoY and +5.9% MoM (vs. November 2024: +0.9% YoY, -0.4% MoM) with all commodity groups recording positive growth, where the group of information and communication equipment, spare parts and accessories, as well as cultural and recreation goods experienced the highest growth.

marketNews.title: OJK Targets Banking Credit Growth in the Range of +9-11% YoY in 2025
marketNews.content: OJK targets banking credit growth in the range of +9-11% YoY in 2025, with a target for third-party funds (DPK) growth of approximately +6-8% YoY. OJK's credit growth target is unchanged from the 2024 target and is lower than the target set by Bank Indonesia in the range of +11-13% YoY in 2025. Throughout 2024, the banking industry recorded credit growth of +10.39% YoY, with third-party fund growth of +4.48% YoY.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Governor Perry Warjiyo Says Liquidity Measure Will Support Government Housing Goal
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia Governor, Perry Warjiyo, stated on Tuesday (11/2) that the central bank will increase liquidity for banks channeling loans into the property segment. This liquidity increase will be done by gradually reducing the minimum required reserve ratio (Giro Wajib Minimum) to free up liquidity of 80 trillion rupiah, higher than the current level of 23.2 trillion rupiah. This is done to support the government's target of building 3 million houses per year.

marketNews.title: OJK Targets Six Banks to Graduate to KBMI 4 by 2027 at the Latest
marketNews.content: OJK Head of Banking Supervision, Dian Ediana Rae, stated on Tuesday (11/2) that the OJK targets the number of banks in the core capital category (KBMI) 4 to increase to 10 banks in the next 2-3 years, although she did not specify which banks are potential candidates to enter this group in the near future. One of OJK's efforts to achieve this target is by encouraging voluntary consolidation. Dian stated that strengthening the banking sector is crucial to support the +8% economic growth target set by President Prabowo Subianto. KBMI 4 is defined as banks with core capital exceeding 70 trillion rupiah; currently, only four banks are in this group: Bank Mandiri (BMRI), Bank Central Asia (BBCA), Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI), and Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI).

marketNews.title: IDX Plans to Launch Short Selling by Early Q2 2025
marketNews.content: IDX Director, Jeffrey Hendrik, stated that the exchange plans to implement short selling and intraday short selling around the end of Q1 2025 or the beginning of Q2 2025. This step is intended to help investors face uncertain market conditions. Previously, the IDX had issued and enforced 2 regulations to implement short selling transactions on October 3, 2024, but as of now, no stock members have obtained short selling permits. Jeffrey explained that the IDX is currently finalizing permits for stock exchange members.

marketNews.title: Deputy Minister of ESDM Confirms Director General of Oil and Gas Suspended as of February 10, 2025
marketNews.content: Deputy Minister of ESDM, Yuliot Tanjung, confirmed that the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources suspended the Director General of Oil and Gas, Achmad Muchtasyar, effective Monday (10/2), less than a month after his inauguration on January 16, 2025. Yuliot stated that the decision was made after an internal evaluation, although he did not elaborate further. Minister of ESDM, Bahlil Lahadalia, stated that the position of Acting (Plh) Director General of Oil and Gas is filled by the Director General of Mineral and Coal, Tri Winarno. Katadata reported that the suspension of Achmad Muchtasyar occurred after the Attorney General's Office searched the office of the Directorate General of Oil and Gas at the Ministry of ESDM on Monday (10/2). Head of Legal Information Center of the Attorney General's Office, Harli Siregar, stated that the search was related to alleged corruption in the governance of crude oil and refinery products at PT Pertamina for the period 2018-2023.

tickerNews.title: Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) FY24 Net Profit +0.1% YoY, Slightly Below Expectations
tickerNews.content: Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) recorded a decrease in net profit in 4Q24 to 15.1 trillion rupiah (-6.3% YoY, -1.8% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 2024 to 60.2 trillion rupiah (+0.1% YoY), slightly below expectations as it equals 98.5% of the consensus estimate. This performance was caused by: 1) Net Interest Margin (NIM) in line with guidance; 2) cost of credit (CoC) worse than guidance; and 3) credit growth below guidance. NIM In Line with Guidance; 2025 NIM Target at 7.3-7.7%. BBRI recorded a decrease in NIM to the level of 7.4% in 4Q24 (vs. 4Q23: 8.3%, 3Q24: 8%), so the NIM for 2024 fell to 7.74% (vs. 2023: 8.2%) and was in line with management guidance in the range of 7.6-8%. Loan yield for 2024 increased to 13.2% (vs. 2023: 13.1%), while the cost of fund rose to 3.7% (vs. 2023: 3.1%). BBRI management targets NIM in 2025 to slightly decline in the range of 7.3-7.7%, and provides guidance regarding the potential for a one-off adjustment from modification loss which may impact NIM during 1H25. CoC Worse than Guidance; 2025 CoC Target at 3-3.2%. BBRI recorded an improvement in CoC to 2.8% in 4Q24 (vs. 4Q23: 2.2%, 3Q24: 3.2%), although high CoC at the beginning of the year still caused the CoC throughout 2024 to swell to 3.2% (vs. 2023: 2.4%) and was worse than management guidance targeting CoC below 3%. The fact that CoC was worse than guidance was also caused by lower credit growth than guidance. This is reflected in the +41% YoY increase in provision expenses during 2024, which resulted in flat net profit growth. BBRI management targets CoC in 2025 in the range of 3-3.2%, and provides guidance regarding the potential increase in CoC in 1Q25 along with the plan for front loading provisioning from subsidiaries and modification loss. CoC is expected to start normalizing in 2H25. In terms of asset quality, Loan-at-Risk (LAR) improved to 10.7% in 4Q24 (vs. 4Q23: 12.5%, 3Q24: 11.7%), while Gross NPL also dropped to 2.8% (vs. 4Q23: 3%, 3Q24: 2.9%) and was in line with management guidance targeting NPL below 3%. BBRI management also provided guidance that Special Mention Loans (SML) are expected to increase until 1H25, with NPLs for the micro and ultra-micro segments remaining high. Credit Growth Below Guidance; 2025 Target at +7-9% YoY. BBRI recorded credit growth of +7% YoY in 2024 (vs. 2023: +11.2% YoY, 3Q24: +8.2% YoY), lower than management guidance in the range of +10-12% YoY. This realization was supported by the corporate (+24% YoY) and consumer (+10% YoY) segments, with a slowdown in the growth of the micro segment (+2.7% YoY) and small segment (-0.7% YoY). Meanwhile, third-party funds (DPK) only grew +0.5% YoY in 2024, in line with the company's strategy to lower time deposits (TD), resulting in the bank entity's Loan-to-Deposit Ratio (LDR) reaching 88.9% in 2024 (vs. 4Q23: 84.2%). BBRI management targets credit growth in the range of +7-9% YoY in 2025. 2024 Dividend Payout Ratio (DPR) Minimum 85%. BBRI management plans to propose a DPR for the 2024 fiscal year of a minimum of 85% (vs. 2023: 80%) at the AGM in March 2025, indicating a dividend yield of approximately ~8.3% (including the interim dividend in December 2024) based on the share price as of Wednesday (12/2) at 4,030 rupiah per share. Key Takeaway. We assess BBRI's performance as mixed. Generally, we are cautious about the future outlook, especially due to management guidance suggesting a difficult condition in 1Q25 before it is expected to gradually improve in 2Q25-4Q25. On the other hand, although worse than guidance, we see a positive side in the improving trend of CoC and asset quality, which were the main concerns regarding BBRI's performance in 2024. We believe NIM and credit cost are the two main things investors need to watch regarding BBRI going forward.

tickerNews.title: MSCI Opens Input Regarding Investment Eligibility of BREN, CUAN, and PTRO
tickerNews.content: MSCI announced that they will welcome input from market participants and investors regarding the investment eligibility of Barito Renewables Energy (BREN), Petrindo Jaya Kreasi (CUAN), and Petrosea (PTRO) no later than March 31, 2025. MSCI also mentioned that it will provide clarity on the treatment of these three shares for the May 2025 index review by April 11, 2025. Previously, MSCI announced that BREN, CUAN, and PTRO would not be included in the MSCI Indonesia Investable Market Index in the February 2025 index review after analysis and input regarding potential investability constraints. This decision was based on analysis and input from market participants that these three stocks might not be sufficiently eligible for investment due to potential concerns about share ownership concentration.

tickerNews.title: Minister of ESDM Bahlil Lahadalia States Downstream Projects Will Be Funded by Danantara Through Bank Mandiri (BMRI)
tickerNews.content: Minister of ESDM, Bahlil Lahadalia, said that downstream projects will be financed by the Danantara Investment Management Body through Bank Mandiri (BMRI). Bahlil mentioned that the government targets investment funds for the downstream program for 28 commodities to reach 618 billion USD or 10,124.7 trillion rupiah by 2040. Meanwhile, the President Director of BMRI, Darmawan Junaidi, said that BMRI is still awaiting further information regarding the implementation and technical rules of the Danantara Investment Management Body, which was just established in early February 2025 through the revision of the BUMN Law.

tickerNews.title: Chandra Asri Pacific Director Raymond Bought 100,000 TPIA Shares
tickerNews.content: Chandra Asri Pacific Director, Raymond, purchased 100,000 TPIA shares at an average price of 6,613 rupiah per share on February 11, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 661.3 million rupiah. After this transaction, Raymond's ownership in TPIA increased from 0.00219% to 0.00231%.

tickerNews.title: Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI) President Director Royke Tumilaar Says Sea Group Will Not Enter as a Shareholder in Hibank
tickerNews.content: Bank Negara Indonesia President Director, Royke Tumilaar, stated that Sea Group (NYSE: SE) has canceled entering as a shareholder in PT Bank Hibank Indonesia. Royke mentioned that Hibank's development will be carried out without partnering with other parties, adding that the composition of Hibank's shareholders also remains unchanged. Currently, BBNI is the controller of Hibank with a 63.92% stake after acquiring it in 2022.

tickerNews.title: Bumi Resources Minerals (BRMS) Clarifies Subsidiary CPM Has Environmental Permits for Mining in Poboya, Palu After Environmental Concerns Raised
tickerNews.content: Bumi Resources Minerals stated in a clarification that its subsidiary, PT Citra Palu Minerals (CPM), has obtained government approval and secured environmental impact analysis (AMDAL) permits to conduct open-pit and underground mining activities in Poboya, Palu, Central Sulawesi. BRMS's statement followed a statement by Mukhtaruddin, a member of Commission XII of the DPR, on Tuesday (11/2) urging the government to investigate alleged environmental pollution from the gold mining process by PT Citra Palu Minerals. Previously, several mass groups held demonstrations due to concerns that PT Citra Palu Minerals was damaging the environment around the mining area. BRMS also asserted that the mining activities and operations of the gold ore processing facility belonging to PT Citra Palu Minerals remain ongoing.

tickerNews.title: Darma Henwa (DEWA) Amends Private Placement Exercise Price to Reflect Fair Value Based on KJPP Report
tickerNews.content: Darma Henwa (DEWA) stated in a clarification to the IDX that the amendment of the private placement exercise price from 65 rupiah per share to 75 rupiah per share was due to the company's effort to obtain a better conversion price that reflects the fair value based on the public appraisal services office (KJPP) report. DEWA mentioned that the KJPP independently reviewed the company's financial projections, resulting in a change in the fair value of DEWA shares from 63.9 rupiah per share to 71.05 rupiah per share. DEWA also stated that creditors had no objections to this change in the share conversion price.

tickerNews.title: Kalbe Farma (KLBF) Allocates IDR 1 Trillion in Capex for 2025, Targeting Revenue and Net Profit Growth of +8-10% YoY
tickerNews.content: Kalbe Farma Corporate External Communication, Hari Nugroho, stated that the company allocates a capex of 1 trillion rupiah in 2025, unchanged compared to 2024. This capex fund will be used to support business expansion and routine capex such as machine maintenance. KLBF itself targets revenue and net profit to grow by +8-10% YoY, respectively, in 2025, with margins expected to be stable compared to 2024. To mitigate the risk of Rupiah exchange rate weakening against the US dollar, KLBF will use more transactions denominated in Chinese Yuan for raw material purchases from China.

tickerNews.title: AKR Corporindo (AKRA) Controller and Commissioner Utama Increased Share Ownership
tickerNews.content: AKR Corporindo's controller, PT Arthakencana Rayatama, purchased ~3.49 million AKRA shares at an average price of 1,115 rupiah per share on February 6-10, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 3.9 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Arthakencana Rayatama in AKRA increased from ~63.69% to ~63.71%. In a separate transaction, AKRA's controller and President Commissioner, Soegiarto Adikoesoemo, also purchased ~13.7 million AKRA shares at an average price of 1,108 rupiah per share on February 7-11, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 15.1 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the direct ownership of Soegiarto Adikoesoemo in AKRA increased from ~0.51% to ~0.57%.

tickerNews.title: Theodore Permadi Rachmat Bought ~1.4 Million TAPG Shares
tickerNews.content: Triputra Agro Persada shareholder, Theodore Permadi Rachmat, purchased ~1.4 million TAPG shares. The transaction was only recorded in KSEI data as of February 10, 2025, so the average transaction price is unknown. After this transaction, Theodore Permadi Rachmat's ownership in TAPG increased from 5.19% to 5.2%.

tickerNews.title: Jonathan Tahir, Controller and President Commissioner of Sejahteraraya Anugrahjaya (SRAJ), Increased Direct Share Ownership
tickerNews.content: The controller and President Commissioner of Sejahteraraya Anugrahjaya (SRAJ), Jonathan Tahir, purchased ~16.8 million SRAJ shares at an average price of 1,880 rupiah per share on January 14, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 31.6 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the direct ownership of Jonathan Tahir in SRAJ increased from 0.49% to 0.63%.
